title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks - BBC News
summary: detectives from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire major crime unit are to review the death of 19-month-old samuel harry from bedford .
luton-based thomson and first choice are working to bring staff home from tunisia after the foreign office urged holidaymakers to leave over terror threats .
the case of tina beloveth powerful , head of a bogus business school in milton keynes , has been adjourned for a week after she reported in as sick .
a school for deaf and disabled children in buckinghamshire has been put into administration .

documents.title: enjoy your weekend
text: that 's all from us this week on local live for beds , herts and bucks .
we 'll be back on monday , 13 july at 08:00 .
if you missed us today , here 's a round-up of the top stories :
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: nhs trust still has 'way to go '
text: buckinghamshire healthcare nhs trust
author: Buckingham Advertiser

documents.title: cctv of men attempting luton break-in
text: police have released images of two men they want to trace in connection with an attempted break-in in luton .
offenders tried to force their way into a property in hamel court off abbotswood road on tuesday .
it is believed the men arrived and left in a white van .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: tunisia attack : 'we feel incredibly safe '
text: a woman from high wycombe has been telling her story of holidaying in tunisia since the
`` we saw quite a lot of armed guards on the journey from the airport , and there 's a huge amount of security near the beach '' , ruth osborne told the
`` the hotel itself has security at the front and at the back , by the pool and by the beach we feel incredibly safe . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

the a5 is busy as a result , as are the roads through the woodside estate in dunstable to houghton regis (
there are also some delays on
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : warm but cloudy
text: staying dry and warm through this evening with further sunny spells .
dry at first tonight , but increasing cloud for a time might bring a few showers , before clear spells return later in the night .
light to moderate southerly winds , with temperatures falling to 12c ( 55f ) .
saturday will be mostly dry with sunny spells , but turning progressively cloudier through the afternoon with perhaps an isolated shower .
feeling warm with a freshening westerly breeze , temperatures reaching up to 24c ( 75f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: bedford 's turbo roundabout
text: bedford is the home of many things - john bunyan , mayor dave and the uk 's first 'turbo ' roundabout .
the turbo roundabout has just won another award , this time for academic inspiration .
what 's different about it you ask ?
it has raised lane dividers ; white and orange poles to be precise .
reporter matt lockwood has used the roundabout , and had this to say : `` i just do n't know why roundabouts ca n't just be roundabouts anymore . ''
author: Roberto Perrone
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: wycombe sign qpr defender
text: wycombe wanderers have signed qpr defender michael harriman on loan until the end of january .
the full back was at luton last season and had a loan spell with wycombe three seasons ago .
`` he can play in a number of positions , he 's got great talent on and off the ball and you always know you 'll get 100 % effort and commitment from him .
i 'm really pleased to have him back '' , said wycombe manager gareth ainsworth .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: herts man said child 's injuries were accidental
text: a hertfordshire man has been sent to prison for three years for causing injuries to a child , alone in his care , despite claiming they were accidental .

matthew challis , 34 , of kingsmead road , bishops stortford , maintained his innocence `` and disputed medical evidence which concluded that the baby had been shaken and the injuries he sustained were not accidental '' , investigating officer det con ian forsith said .
`` the boy is being monitored and we will have to wait and see whether the injuries he sustained at the hands of matthew challis have any lasting impact on his life moving forward . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: bedfordshire golf club members buy-out fails
text: members who tried to
mentmore golf and country club , which ceased trading on 7 june , has been purchased by mentmore golf corporate limited .

club captains martin cowling and anne bridges , who led the members buy-out bid , say they will be in talks with the new company in an attempt to understand future plans and whether memberships will be honoured .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: watford to make behrami move ?
text: watford are being linked with former west ham midfielder valon behrami .
the switzerland international , 30 , is currently with german club hamburg and has also played for the likes of genoa , lazio , fiorentina and napoli .
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: airport warns of m1 delays
text: london luton airport
# m1 earlier incident still causing delays j11 - 12 northbound .
please consider alternate routes if travelling to the airport .

documents.title: bedford child death : case to be reviewed
text: detectives from the bedfordshire , cambridgeshire and hertfordshire major crime unit are to review the death of
at a two-day inquest in ampthill yesterday , coroner martin oldham recorded a verdict of 'unlawful killing ' and police are to review the case because of this .
an investigation initially took place in 2013 and two people were arrested , but there was n't enough evidence for the crown prosecution service to charge anyone .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: problems on m1
text: there 's been a multi-vehicle accident on the m1 northbound between j11-j12 .
two lanes are closed and there is queuing traffic on
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: man jailed for attempting to rob post office
text: a man 's been jailed for attempting to rob a post office in barton-le-clay .
lee hull , 32 , from mill road in leighton buzzard , entered the post office last year with imitation weapons demanding money .
when the post mistress refused , he and his accomplice left but they were traced because a member of the public came forward with a car registration number .
after being arrested and bailed mr hull fled to the republic of ireland but returned three months later and gave himself up .
he was sentenced for five years and three months at luton crown court .
author: Barry Caffrey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: breakingreview of bedford child death
text: police are to review the case of the death of 19-month-old samuel harry from bedford in light of the coroner 's verdict .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: car hits tree in high wycombe
text: a man is being treated by paramedics after his car hit a tree in high wycombe .
firefighters were called to the crash in hollis road shortly after 13:00 .
author: Barry Caffrey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: marcus hall murder : case adjourned
text: a man accused of murdering student marcus hall in luton 14 years ago has appeared in court today .
adebayo ekun , 38 , was extradited from nigeria following his arrest in february , and a trial date set for august .
the case was adjourned until 27 july at luton crown court .
eighteen-year-old marcus ( was beaten and stabbed to death after attending a so solid crew gig in march 2001 .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: delays on m25 and trains
text: there is congestion on the a421 in milton keynes at the kingston roundabout through the roadworks .
on the m25 anti-clockwise there is slow traffic between j17 and j12 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: father campaigning for law change after son 's death
text: the father of a bedford boy who
`` we 're running an online campaign justice for sam '' , his father nicholas harry told the bbc this morning .

`` we 've got 20,000 signatures so far but we need to get it up to 100,000 signatures so that we can present it to parliament and say , look something 's not right , we know that this is wrong , we know that this should n't be allowed to happen . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

they 're looking for an

documents.title: tunisia attack : watford victim memorial to be removed
text: a memorial to watford fan chris dyer , who died in the
watford have confirmed the memorial in vicarage road will be 'carefully removed ' and offered to mr dyer 's family in the week leading up to the sevilla friendly on 31 july .
a spokesman for the club also said that chris ' passing will be marked at that game .
author: Matthew Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hertfordshire man jailed for injuring child
text: a man from bishops stortford has been jailed for three years for causing injuries to a four-month-old boy .
the boy was taken to hospital in essex after a fit , where he was found to have various injuries to his body and a ct scan revealed a bleed to the brain .

matthew challis , 34 , of kingsmead road , was sentenced at chelmsford crown court yesterday to three years imprisonment for causing serious physical harm to a child by means of an unlawful act , and ordered to pay a victim surcharge of £ 120 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: crackdown on domestic abuse
text: police in bedfordshire have arrested 19 people in a crackdown on domestic abuse .
raids were carried out at numerous addresses last tuesday , and tuesday this week .
four people have been charged with a total of eight offences , including assault , theft and criminal damage .
author: Barry Caffrey
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: winger signs first watford contract
text: watford youngster dennon lewis has signed a
the 18-year-old , who has yet to make a first-team appearance for the hornets , is a graduate of the club 's academy .
`` hopefully i can progress into the first team and play in the premier league , '' lewis told the club website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: illegal rave investigation
text: police in buckinghamshire are investigating after an illegal rave in the county last weekend .
about 80 people attended the rave , held on farmland near buckland in aylesbury vale .
calls were made to police at about 01:00 and the event was shut down shortly afterwards .
officers are investigating to identify the organisers .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: tunisia 'exceptionally quiet , ' says bucks woman
text: `` yesterday there was a grand total of 34 guests in this hotel , and there should be 800 . ''
those were the words of ruth osborne from high wycombe , who has been telling the
`` we had n't got the choice to cancel [ because we did n't book with thomson ] , but what we did do was waited until the dust had settled '' , ruth said .
despite `` huge amounts of security , '' ruth said her husband and two friends have been able to enjoy their holiday , but `` it 's been exceptionally quiet '' .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: a man accused of murdering a student 14 years ago is due back at luton crown court later today .
marcus hall , 18 , ( was beaten and stabbed to death near luton 's atmosphere nightclub after attending a so solid crew gig in march 2001 .
adebayo ekun , 38 , was extradited from nigeria following his arrest in february and a provisional trial date has been set for august .

text: this afternoon , we will continue to see plenty of sunshine and blue skies .
it will be a dry and very warm day with highs of 26c ( 79f ) .
cloud will thicken from the west later this evening , with some patchy rain spreading east .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: electoral fraud in luton
text: luton borough council has confirmed it has referred an allegation of suspected electoral fraud onto bedfordshire police .
the force will now investigate whether postal vote forms were fraudulently submitted in the general election on 7 may .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: house fires in milton keynes
text: two homes in milton keynes have been damaged after what has been described as a `` severe house fire '' yesterday afternoon .
about 25 firefighters were called to gardiner court in blue bridge just after 15:30 .
no-one was injured .
station commander ian wilson captured these from the turntable ladder .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: they 've played the bbc introducing stage at reading and leeds and on saturday , 1 august they will headline our bbc introducing stage at
author: BBC Introducing... Beds, Herts & Bucks

documents.title: high wycombe woman in tunisia
text: thousands of british holiday makers are to be flown home from tunisia following warnings that another terrorist attack in the country is highly likely .
ruth osborne , from high wycombe , is in tunisia with her husband and two friends now having flown there 10 days ago .
`` we now have the army outside our hotel , the port is surrounded .
we 're leaving the hotel at 07:00 tomorrow , '' ruth told me .
author: Jonathan Vernon-Smith
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: police investigate atm ram-raid
text: police are looking for anyone with information about the ram-raid of an atm in cranfield over the weekend , where thieves made off with `` valuable equipment and cash '' .

an agricultural vehicle , believed to have been stolen from somewhere in buckinghamshire , was used to dislodge a barclays cash machine from the side of a post office in college road , cranfield at about 02:00 last saturday .
it was then loaded onto another vehicle and driven away , while the stolen vehicle ( was left at the scene .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

text: there are delays of up to 20 minutes on trains travelling between stevenage and peterborough due to a signalling problem at hitchin .

documents.title: bogus business school owner to be sentenced
text: the head of bogus business school in milton keynes is to be sentenced today after being found
dr tina beloveth powerful , 47 , will appear before milton keynes magistrates ' court for sentencing at 11:00 .
she has already vowed to appeal against whatever sentence comes her way .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

joshua has won all 13 of his fights as a professional inside three rounds , but lost to whyte as an amateur .

documents.title: house damaged after caravan fire
text: a house has been damaged in bletchley in the early hours of this morning after the suspected arson of a caravan .
the caravan , parked on the front garden of the house in conway crescent , caught fire and it took three crews to put the blaze out just after 01:30 .
residents were n't in the house at the time , police say .
an investigation is under way .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

author: David Keller

author: Welwyn Hatfield Times

documents.title: penn school : statement from administrators
text: we have received a statement from deloitte regarding the
it says pupil numbers went down considerably after a poor inspection in 2013 , and the financial pressures had made the school unviable .

lee manning , joint administrator , said : `` a recent unanticipated reduction in the expected numbers for the next academic year has meant that , despite the efforts of the trustees , the school is no longer in a position to continue as a going concern '' .
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: school goes into administration
text: the parents of 50 deaf and disabled children have been told they 'll have to make alternative arrangements come september as their residential school faces an uncertain future .
the penn school in penn , buckinghamshire , went into administration on wednesday with the warning that , unless a buyer is found , it 'll close at the end of term .

lee manning , joint administrator for deloitte , said : `` our priority is the welfare of this vulnerable group of children and we are consulting closely with staff , pupils and parents during this difficult period . ''
author: David Keller
BBC News

documents.title: caravan blaze damages house
text: we 're just hearing reports that a suspected arson attack on a caravan in bletchley has caused quite a bit of damage to the front of a house .
buckinghamshire and milton keynes fire service said it was called to a blaze outside the house on conway crescent at 01:35 bst .
three crews managed to successfully put out the fire .
there are no reports of injuries , but we 'll bring you more when we get it .
author: David Keller
BBC News

maximum temperature of 26 deg c ( 79 deg f ) .
